comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: Alright I understood your report, but that's not really correct to connect those accounts.1. Karish2return and Thenoss have used same address (0xA07ef5d740D5000C3bc5bba7751f27F9AAefDA47) but if you look Karish2return application, the username is still Thenoss (probably he copied Thenoss application). However his account was painted by DT and he didn't active in bounty anymore before August 2021, I'm pretty sure Karish2return want to ruin Thenoss reputation since Thenoss has been actively expose many cheaters.2. You're connecting the accounts from their transactions, however as far as I can see it's just a normal transactions since it doesn't like the 6 accounts move all of their token to parent address (to save fee). It doesn't have a problem if someone made a trade through this forum, we have currency exchange board for doing that.

However his account was painted by DT and he didn't active in bounty anymore before August 2021, I'm pretty sure Karish2return want to ruin Thenoss reputation since Thenoss has been actively expose many cheaters. sorry am not good in english am use google translatethis could be a trap but at least there is an archive of their wallet.and I'm not here saying they cheated on the bounty but only the account is connected via tx recordthis is a post from Karish2return https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=840344;sa=showPostsif  accidentally copy Thenoss proof

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: Quote from: rony01 on May 19, 2022, 04:29:09 AMsorry am not good in english am use google translateNo problem.QuoteI'm not here saying they cheated on the bounty but only the account is connected via tx recordThat's make your report is pointless, what's your purpose to create this thread if you only want to connect those accounts since using multiple accounts in this forum is allowed as long as you not doing any harm. As I said before, a tx record/transactions doesn't really prove the accounts are connected.Quotethis is a post from Karish2return https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=840344;sa=showPostsif  accidentally copy Thenoss proofI take back my words, it seems @Karish2return didn't accidentally copied @Thenoss applications since @Thenoss using that's address too in many bounties. The interesting thing is why @Thenoss edited his applications and hide his address? Does this mean he scared if someone find him using 0xA07ef5d740D5000C3bc5bba7751f27F9AAefDA47 address since it's linked with @Karish2return (@Karish2return account already red tagged, the other account deserve a red tag too since he's the one who control those accounts).Quote from: Karish2return on May 09, 2022, 09:41:41 AMForum Username: Karish2returnForum Profile Link: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=840344Telegram Username: @sirf2bParticipated Campaigns: VideoBEP-20 Wallet Address: 0xA07ef5d740D5000C3bc5bba7751f27F9AAefDA47Original applicationQuoteProof of authenticationForum name: Thenosshttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3470702Wallet: 0xA07ef5d740D5000C3bc5bba7751f27F9AAefDA47https://ninjastic.space/post/60018943Updated applicationQuote from: Thenoss on May 01, 2022, 11:37:21 AMProof of authenticationForum name: Thenosshttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3470702Campaign: Twitter, TGIf anyone want to see other applications by @Thenoss, you can check in this link https://ninjastic.space/address/0xA07ef5d740D5000C3bc5bba7751f27F9AAefDA47 Waiting for other users to react on this issues.
